http://purl.org/dc/terms/title.@value: Dublin Core Metadata Element Set, Version 1.1

http://purl.org/dc/terms/description.@value: Examples of a Contributor include a person, an organization, or a service. Typically, the name of a Contributor should be used to indicate the entity.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: An entity responsible for making contributions to the resource.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#note.@value: A second property with the same name as this property has been declared in the dcterms: namespace (http://purl.org/dc/terms/).  See the Introduction to the document "DCMI Metadata Terms" (http://dublincore.org/documents/dcmi-terms/) for an explanation.

http://purl.org/dc/terms/description.@value: Spatial topic and spatial applicability may be a named place or a location specified by its geographic coordinates. Temporal topic may be a named period, date, or date range. A jurisdiction may be a named administrative entity or a geographic place to which the resource applies. Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary such as the Thesaurus of Geographic Names [TGN]. Where appropriate, named places or time periods can be used in preference to numeric identifiers such as sets of coordinates or date ranges.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: The spatial or temporal topic of the resource, the spatial applicability of the resource, or the jurisdiction under which the resource is relevant.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#note.@value: A second property with the same name as this property has been declared in the dcterms: namespace (http://purl.org/dc/terms/).  See the Introduction to the document "DCMI Metadata Terms" (http://dublincore.org/documents/dcmi-terms/) for an explanation.

http://purl.org/dc/terms/description.@value: Examples of a Creator include a person, an organization, or a service. Typically, the name of a Creator should be used to indicate the entity.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: An entity primarily responsible for making the resource.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#note.@value: A second property with the same name as this property has been declared in the dcterms: namespace (http://purl.org/dc/terms/).  See the Introduction to the document "DCMI Metadata Terms" (http://dublincore.org/documents/dcmi-terms/) for an explanation.

http://purl.org/dc/terms/description.@value: Date may be used to express temporal information at any level of granularity.  Recommended best practice is to use an encoding scheme, such as the W3CDTF profile of ISO 8601 [W3CDTF].

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: A point or period of time associated with an event in the lifecycle of the resource.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#note.@value: A second property with the same name as this property has been declared in the dcterms: namespace (http://purl.org/dc/terms/).  See the Introduction to the document "DCMI Metadata Terms" (http://dublincore.org/documents/dcmi-terms/) for an explanation.

http://purl.org/dc/terms/description.@value: Description may include but is not limited to: an abstract, a table of contents, a graphical representation, or a free-text account of the resource.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: An account of the resource.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#note.@value: A second property with the same name as this property has been declared in the dcterms: namespace (http://purl.org/dc/terms/).  See the Introduction to the document "DCMI Metadata Terms" (http://dublincore.org/documents/dcmi-terms/) for an explanation.

http://purl.org/dc/terms/description.@value: Examples of dimensions include size and duration. Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary such as the list of Internet Media Types [MIME].

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: The file format, physical medium, or dimensions of the resource.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#note.@value: A second property with the same name as this property has been declared in the dcterms: namespace (http://purl.org/dc/terms/).  See the Introduction to the document "DCMI Metadata Terms" (http://dublincore.org/documents/dcmi-terms/) for an explanation.

http://purl.org/dc/terms/description.@value: Recommended best practice is to identify the resource by means of a string conforming to a formal identification system.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: An unambiguous reference to the resource within a given context.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#note.@value: A second property with the same name as this property has been declared in the dcterms: namespace (http://purl.org/dc/terms/).  See the Introduction to the document "DCMI Metadata Terms" (http://dublincore.org/documents/dcmi-terms/) for an explanation.

http://purl.org/dc/terms/description.@value: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary such as RFC 4646 [RFC4646].

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: A language of the resource.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#note.@value: A second property with the same name as this property has been declared in the dcterms: namespace (http://purl.org/dc/terms/).  See the Introduction to the document "DCMI Metadata Terms" (http://dublincore.org/documents/dcmi-terms/) for an explanation.

http://purl.org/dc/terms/description.@value: Examples of a Publisher include a person, an organization, or a service. Typically, the name of a Publisher should be used to indicate the entity.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: An entity responsible for making the resource available.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#note.@value: A second property with the same name as this property has been declared in the dcterms: namespace (http://purl.org/dc/terms/).  See the Introduction to the document "DCMI Metadata Terms" (http://dublincore.org/documents/dcmi-terms/) for an explanation.

http://purl.org/dc/terms/description.@value: Recommended best practice is to identify the related resource by means of a string conforming to a formal identification system.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: A related resource.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#note.@value: A second property with the same name as this property has been declared in the dcterms: namespace (http://purl.org/dc/terms/).  See the Introduction to the document "DCMI Metadata Terms" (http://dublincore.org/documents/dcmi-terms/) for an explanation.

http://purl.org/dc/terms/description.@value: Typically, rights information includes a statement about various property rights associated with the resource, including intellectual property rights.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: Information about rights held in and over the resource.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#note.@value: A second property with the same name as this property has been declared in the dcterms: namespace (http://purl.org/dc/terms/).  See the Introduction to the document "DCMI Metadata Terms" (http://dublincore.org/documents/dcmi-terms/) for an explanation.

http://purl.org/dc/terms/description.@value: The described resource may be derived from the related resource in whole or in part. Recommended best practice is to identify the related resource by means of a string conforming to a formal identification system.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: A related resource from which the described resource is derived.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#note.@value: A second property with the same name as this property has been declared in the dcterms: namespace (http://purl.org/dc/terms/).  See the Introduction to the document "DCMI Metadata Terms" (http://dublincore.org/documents/dcmi-terms/) for an explanation.

http://purl.org/dc/terms/description.@value: Typically, the subject will be represented using keywords, key phrases, or classification codes. Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: The topic of the resource.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#note.@value: A second property with the same name as this property has been declared in the dcterms: namespace (http://purl.org/dc/terms/).  See the Introduction to the document "DCMI Metadata Terms" (http://dublincore.org/documents/dcmi-terms/) for an explanation.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: A name given to the resource.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#note.@value: A second property with the same name as this property has been declared in the dcterms: namespace (http://purl.org/dc/terms/).  See the Introduction to the document "DCMI Metadata Terms" (http://dublincore.org/documents/dcmi-terms/) for an explanation.

http://purl.org/dc/terms/description.@value: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary such as the DCMI Type Vocabulary [DCMITYPE]. To describe the file format, physical medium, or dimensions of the resource, use the Format element.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: The nature or genre of the resource.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#note.@value: A second property with the same name as this property has been declared in the dcterms: namespace (http://purl.org/dc/terms/).  See the Introduction to the document "DCMI Metadata Terms" (http://dublincore.org/documents/dcmi-terms/) for an explanation.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: Asset misappropriation fraud happens when people who are entrusted to manage the assets of an organisation steal from it or misuses these assets.
Consiste en apropiarse de activos financieros o no financieros de la organización, bien robándolos, bien realizando un uso indebido de éstos
Both Cash and financial asset missapropriation schemes
Esquemas de apropiación de activos financieros o monetarios
Esquemas de apropiación de activos no financieros de la organización
Non financial asset missapropriation schemes
Situación en la que una persona u organización tiene intereses financieros o de otro tipo con terceros que podrían corromper la motivación o la toma de decisiones de ese individuo u organización.

Situation in which a person or organization is involved in multiple interests, financial or otherwise, one of which could possibly corrupt the motivation or decision-making of that individual or organization.

La sobrefacturación a una organización por bienes o servicios por parte de un proveedor en la que un empleado o directivo de la organización tiene un interés no manifestado de tipo financiero o de propiedad
Type of conflict of interest which involves the overbilling of a company for goods or services by a vendor in which an employee has an undisclosed ownership or financial interest.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#lab.@value: conflicto de interés por esquema de compras

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: La venta a una organización de bienes o servicios en menor cuantía o importe a un cliente en la que un empleado o directivo de la organización tiene un interés no manifestado de tipo financiero o de propiedad
Type of conflict of interest which involves the underselling of company goods by an employee to a company in which the employee maintains a hidden interest.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#lab.@value: conflicto de interés por esquema de ventas

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: A scheme in which an employee misuses his or her influence in a business transaction in a way that violates his or her duty to the employer in order to gain a direct or indirect benefit.

El empleado hace un uso indebido de su influencia en una transacción comercial de una manera que viola su deber para con el empleador a fin de obtener un beneficio directo o indirecto, para él o para la organización
Quien comete el fraude
Someone who commits fraud
Organization or person that commits a fraud against another Agent
Tercero que comete un fraude contra una persona u organización
Empleado que comete un fraude contra su empresa
Employee who commits fraud against its Employer
a person employed by a company for wages or salary
persona que trabaja para una organización por un salario

Se produce cuando hay un empleado dado de alta en los registros de nómina de la organización, pero no realiza trabajo para la empresa, bien porque es una persona inventada o porque sea una persona real que no esté realizando labor alguna estando contratada.

Type of payroll scheme where someone is recorded on the payroll system, but who does not work for the business. The ghost can be a real person who knowingly or not is placed on the payroll, or a fictitious person invented by the dishonest employee.
equipo de una organización dedicado a investigar o prevenir fraude, bien dentro de su organización o para otras.
team of an organization dedicated to investigate or prevent fraud within their company or in other company
Ocurre cuando un empleado pasa una factura a la empresa para que realice el pago o cuando el empleado utiliza una tarjeta de crédito para el pago de una compra personal.
Type of billing scheme which occurs when an employee submits an invoice for personal purchases to the company for payment, or when an employee uses a company credit card for personal purchases.
Este tipo de fraude ocurre cuando un empleado arregla el sobrepago de una factura de un proveedor y se queda con el excedente del coste real de la factura
Type of billing scheme which occurs when an employee arranges for overpayment of a vendor invoice and pockets the overpayment amount when it is returned to the company.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#lab.@value: esquema de connivencia con el proveedor

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: Se produce cuando la comisión por ventas se altera o se modifican las ventas realizadas.
Type of payroll scheme which occurs when the amount of sales made or the rate of commission is fraudulently inflated.
Ocurre cuando empleados con poderes de firma realizan cheques para su propio beneficio
Type of check tampering scheme which occurs when employees with signature authority write fraudulent checks for their own benefit.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#lab.@value: Se produce cuando una empresa ficticia o sin facturación real controlada por el empleado emite facturas a la organización del empleado.
Type of billing scheme which occurs when an employee submits invoices for payment from a fictitious company controlled by the employee.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: Corruption scheme which occur when an employee demands payment from a vendor for decisions made in the vendor’s favor. Refusal to pay the extorter results in harm to the vendor.
Cuando un empleado reclama el pago de un vendedor por decisiones realizadas en favor del proveedor. Si un proveedor rechaza realizar el pago, el defraudador le causa algún tipo de daño
Este esquema consiste en falsificar la firma de endoso de un receptor de un cheque de la organización.
Type of check tampering scheme which consists of forging the signature endorsement of an intended recipient of a company check.
Ocurre cuando se prepara un cheque falsificado y se junta con otros legítimos para su pago habitual por parte de la empresa, de forma que el emisor del cheque lo firma sin haber sido revisado
Type of check tampering scheme which consists of preparing a fraudulent check and submitting it usually along with legitimate checks to an authorized maker who signs it without a proper review.
Type of check tampering scheme which involves forging an authorized signature on a company check.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#lab.@value: Se produce cuando se altera o falsifica una firma autorizada en un cheque

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: Ocurre cuando se paga al empleado un salario sobre la base de tarifas falsificadas u horas no incurridas.
Type of payroll scheme which occurs when a company pays an employee based on falsified hours or rates
falsificación de salarios

Acto intencional cometido por una persona u organización para obtener un beneficio actual o futuro que cause un perjuicio económico o contra la propiedad a un tercero mediante el engaño, la ocultación u otros actos desleales
A scheme in which an employee intentionally causes a misstatement or omission of material information in the organization’s financial reports.
Cuando un empleado causa una alteración u omisión voluntaria y de la información financiera de la organización
Fraud commited by a third party not related to the organization.
Fraude producido por un tercero contra la organización, esto es, aquel que no es producido por un empleado de la compañía.
Fraud commited by an employee, administrator or exectuive against the organization he/she is working for
Fraude cometido por un empleado, gerente o directivo de la organización para la que trabaja
Dar o recibir algo de valor como contrapartida por una decisión de negocio
This scheme involves giving or receiving something of value to reward a business decision.

Cash larceny may be defined as the intentional taking away of an
employer‘s cash (the term cash includes both currency and checks) without the consent and against the
 will of the employer. That cash has already appeared on a victim organisation’s books. Most  larceny schemes involve the theft of incoming cash, currency on hand (in a cash register, cash box, etc.), or theft of cash from the victim organisation’s bank deposits.
Hurto de fondos de la organización que han sido registrados contablemente en libros u otros registros. Estos fondos pueden ser fondos de caja, cheques o depósito bancarios, entre otros.
Actividad destinada a destapar la naturaleza de un fraude,identificar responsables y el destino de los fondos,  establecer una cronología de los hechos y calcular el perjuicio económico

Activity that is carried out by an investigation team to uncover a fraud, identify the fraudster and the destination of the funds, quantify the economic damage and establish a chronology of the events.
Se produce cuando se falsifica o altera la designación del receptor de fondos al defraudador
Type of check tampering scheme which involves changing the payee designation on the check to the perpetrator or an accomplice.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#lab.@value: alteración del beneficiario de los fondos

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: A scheme that occurs when an employee uses his position of employment to cause a payment for some inappropriate purpose.
Este esquema ocurre cuando un empleado utiliza su posición para que la organización realice un pago para un propósito indebido
A scheme in which an employee causes his or her employer to issue a payment by making false claims for compensation.
Ocurre cuando un empleado hace que la organización pague en concepto de nómina o complemento salarial un importe no debido.
A scheme in which a person causes his or her employer to issue a payment by submitting invoices for fictitious goods or services, inflated invoices or invoices for personal purchases.
El defraudador consigue que su organización realice un pago emitiendo facturas por bienes o servicios ficticios, o bien inflando el importe de las facturas o facturas por compras personales

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#lab.@value: pagos fraudulentos por esquemas de facturación

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: A scheme in which a person steals his or her employer’s funds by intercepting, forging or altering a check or electronic payment drawn on one of the organization’s bank accounts.
Se produce cuando el defraudador roba fondos de la organización interceptando, falsificando o alterando un cheque o pago electrónico de una de las cuentas bancarias de la organización
A scheme in which an employee makes a claim for reimbursement of fictitious or inflated business expenses.
Ocurre cuando el empleado reclama el reintegro de un gasto en el que habría incurrido de naturaleza ficticia o por un importe inflado
A scheme in which an employee makes false entries on a cash register to conceal the fraudulent removal of cash.
Se produce cuando el empleado realiza entradas faltas en la contabilidad o registros contables de la organización para realizar una retirada de efectivo.
Activity that is carried out by a forensic team in order to prevent, detect or investigate a fraud

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#lab.@value: Actividad destinada a detectar, prevenir o investigar un fraude

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: A red flag is an indicator  of something that is unusual and may need to be investigated further.
Un redflag es un indicador de algo que necesita ser investigado con más detalle por ser inusual y está asociado a un esquema de fraude
Este esquema se da cuando un empleado solicita el reembolso de un gasto de naturaleza personal, haciéndolo pasar por un gasto de empresa.
Type of expense reimbursement scheme which occurs when an employee requests reimbursement for a personal expense, claiming the expense to be business related.
Se da cuando un empleado se inventa un gasto para que la organización se lo pague.
Type of expense reimbursement scheme which occurs when an employee invents a purchase and seeks reimbursement for it.

Está relacionado con las devoluciones de mercancías en las que un defraudador guarda una copia del recibo del cliente en el momento de la venta y luego lo utiliza para crear un vacío ficticio (es decir, como si el cliente devolviera la mercancía).

This scheme is related to merchandise returns in which a a fraud perpetrator keeps a copy of the customer’s receipt at the time of sale and later uses it to create a fictitious void (i.e., as if the customer returned the merchandise).
Se produce cuando un empleado registra una devolución sin que se esté produciendo
Type of register disbursement scheme which occurs when an employee processes a transaction as if a customer were returning merchandise, even though there is no actual return.
Tipo de reembolsos de gastos que se da cuando un empleado infla el precio o coste de los gastos incurridos para que la organización se los pague.
Type of expense reimbursement scheme which occurs when an employee overstates the cost of actual expenses and seeks reimbursement.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#lab.@value: reintegro fraudulento de gastos por encima de su valor o coste
Ocurre cuando un empleado solicita que un gasto se le reintegre en múltiples ocasiones.
occurs when an employee submits a single expense for reimbursement multiple times.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: A scheme involving the theft of physical inventory items and the misstatement of inventory records on a company's financial statements
Implica el robo de inventario o de activos y su alteración en los registros contables de la organización
Esquemas que implican el robo de fondos de la organización, bien estando éstos registrados contablemente o no
This scheme implies the theft of cash from the organization, having these funds being recorded or not

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#lab.@value: robo en el depósito de la organización
robo de fondos de la caja o en metálico

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: Este esquema ocurre cuando un empleado roba la mercancía de entrada marcando en el albarán de entrada como entrega parcial
Purchasing And Receiving
Type of larceny scheme in which an employee steals incoming merchandise by fraudulently marking incoming shipments as “short” to conceal the theft.
Implica el uso de documentos internos para que inventario o equipamientos se muevan de una localización a otra
Type of larceny scheme which involves the use of internal documents to cause inventory, supplies, or equipment to be moved from one location to another or allocated to a particular project.
Ocurre cuando un defraudador hace que una organización envíe mercancía como si hubiera sido comprada al defraudador o a un cómplice
Type of larceny scheme which occurs when a fraudster causes an organization to ship out merchandise as though it had been sold. The shipments are usually sent to the fraudster or to an accomplice.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#lab.@value: robo por venta y entrega falsa

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: Ocurre cuando un empleado coge material o activos de la organización sin intentar alterar en libros su robo
Type of larceny scheme which occur when an employee takes property from the company’s premises without attempting to conceal it in the books and records.
Registrar ingresos o gastos en periodos contables indebidos
This scheme involves recording revenues or expenses in improper accounting periods.

A fraudulent financial report scheme which involves the improper disclosure of material information, such as contingent liabilities, significant events, management fraud, related-party transactions, or accounting changes.
Consiste en la revelación parcial o en la ocultación de información relevante como transacciones entre grupos, eventos relevantes, fraude en la gestión, cambios en la contabilización, entre otros

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#lab.@value: sobreestimación mediante la indebida comunicación de información relevante

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: A fraudulent financial report scheme which involves recording fictitious revenue from the sale of goods or services.
Registrar ingresos ficticios por ventas de bienes o servicios

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#lab.@value: sobreestimación por registro de ingresos ficticios

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: A fraudulent financial report scheme which involves the improper valuation of inventory, accounts receivable, fixed assets, intangibles, or other assets.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#lab.@value: La valoración indebida de inventario, clientes o activos de la organización
sobreestimación por valoración indebida de activos

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: A fraudulent financial report scheme which involves concealing or understating liabilities and expenses, capitalizing expenses, or expensing capital expenses.
Este esquema consiste en no registrar o minusvalorar los gastos incurridos o deudas con terceros

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#lab.@value: sobreestimación por ocultación o manipulación de deudas o gastos

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: Registrar ingresos o gastos en periodos contables indebidos
This scheme involves recording revenues or expenses in improper accounting periods.
A fraudulent financial report scheme which involves recording fictitious revenue from the sale of goods or services.
Registrar ingresos ficticios por ventas de bienes o servicios

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#lab.@value: subestimación por registro de ingresos ficticios

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: A fraudulent financial report scheme which involves the improper valuation of inventory, accounts receivable, fixed assets, intangibles, or other assets.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#lab.@value: La valoración indebida de inventario, clientes o activos de la organización
subestimación por valoración indebida de activos

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: A fraudulent financial report scheme which involves concealing or understating liabilities and expenses, capitalizing expenses, or expensing capital expenses.
Este esquema consiste en no registrar o minusvalorar los gastos incurridos o deudas con terceros

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#lab.@value: subestimación por ocultación o manipulación de deudas o gastos

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: Consiste en quedarse con todo o parte del importe correspondiente a una devolución sin que quede registrado.
Occurs when the fraudster steals the funds corresponding to a refund without being this refund registered.
En un esquema en el que se roban los fondos de la organización antes de que se registre por ésta en sus libros o registros contables.
The fraud occurs by the theft of incoming customer payments or of non-revenue cash receipts before the funds are deposited and recorded in the accounting records.
Este esquemas están relacionados con el registro de mercancía por cobrar que va a ser dada de baja
These schemes are related to the registration of merchandise or receivable that is going to be deregistered
Consiste en un empleado da de baja un inventario robado como si hubiera sido desechado
Type of skimming scheme which involves an employee writing off the stolen inventory item as scrap or similar in the inventory records so that they coincide with the actual physical inventory levels.
Ocurre cuando se alteran las cuentas por cobrar del registro contable al robar fondos destinados al pago de una cuenta por cobrar.

Type of skimming scheme which involves an accounting method that involves altering the accounts receivable section of the balance sheet when cash that is intended for the payment of a receivable is stolen.
Este esquema se produce cuando no se registra la venta o se registra por un menor valor
This scheme occurs when the sale is not recorded or is understated
Type of skimming scheme which involves an employee booking a lower sale amount of a product or service than the perpetrator actually collected.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#lab.@value: Se produce cuando el defraudador registra un menor valor de la venta de un producto o servicio
Skimming por ventas por menor valor

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: Se produce cuando no se registra la venta y el defraudador se queda con el importe del bien o servicio.
Type of skimming scheme which involves an employee making no record of the sale and pocketing the money received from that good or service.
Corruption scheme which involves the offering, giving, receiving, or soliciting of a thing of value to influence a business decision.
El soborno implica ofrecer, dar, recibir o solicitar una cosa de valor a un tercero para influir en una decisión de negocio
Se produce cuando un proveedor realiza pagos no revelados a los empleados de la sociedadcon el fin de reclutar a los empleados en esquemas de sobrefacturación
Type of bribery scheme which occurs when vendors make undisclosed payments to employees of purchasing companies in order to enlist the employees in overbilling schemes.
Se produce cuando un empleado ayuda de forma fraudulenta a un proveedor para ganar un contrato a lo largo del proceso de licitación
Type of bribery scheme which occurs when an employee fraudulently assists a vendor in winning a contract through the competitive bidding process.
A scheme that  occurs when an employee makes an unauthorized use of his organization’s property without actually stealing the property.
Se produce cuando realiza un uso indebido de un bien  de la organización sin robarlo

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#lab.@value: uso indebido de activos, material o equipos

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: Organization that has suffered the fraud
organización objeto del fraude

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#lab.@value: affects to the organization that is victim of fraud

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: descripción del caso de fraude
description of the fraud case
descripción del indicador de fraude
redflag's description
